title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Malwade J (2025). Homework6: Operations Working Sparse Numeric Data. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://juhimalwade.github.io/Homework6/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Homework6: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data},   author = {Juhi Malwade},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://juhimalwade.github.io/Homework6/}, }

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: Homework6 provides S4 class implementation sparse numeric vectors R. Sparse vectors store non-zero values positions. makes highly memory-efficient vectors containing many zeros. Use cases class include text mining, machine learning, scientific computing data predominantly sparse.

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: can install development version Homework6 GitHub:

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: package implements S4 class called sparse_numeric three slots: value: numeric vector containing non-zero values pos: integer vector indices indicating positions non-zero values length: integer representing length vector, including non-zero zero values.

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: Sparse vectors can created coercing standard numeric vectors using () function. can also construct sparse vectors directly using new() function input values, positions, length.

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: Addition (+): Adds two sparse vectors Subtraction (-): Subtracts one sparse vector another Multiplication (*): Performs element-wise multiplication operations maintain sparse representation.

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: sparse_crossprod: Computes dot product two sparse vectors multiplying overlapping non-zero elements mean: Calculates mean considering full vector length, includes implicit zeros norm: Computes Euclidean (L2) norm stored non-zero values standardize: Scales vector mean zero unit variance

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: package provides conversion sparse dense representations: Convert dense numeric vectors sparse format (vector, "sparse_numeric") Convert sparse vectors back dense format .numeric(sparse_vector) .numeric() method reconstructs full vector zeros appropriate positions

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: plot() method allows visual comparison two sparse vectors. displays non-zero positions values vectors single plot, using different colors distinguish . useful understanding structure overlap sparse data.

title: Operations for Working with Sparse Numeric Data
text: show() method provides clean display sparse vectors, showing: total length vector Positions contain non-zero values actual values positions

text: S4 class representing sparse numeric vectors, storing non-zero values positions.

title: Sparse Numeric Vector (S4 Class) — sparse_numeric-class
text: value Numeric vector non-zero values. pos Integer vector 1-based indices non-zero values. length Integer giving full length represented vector.
